title: 531cc3ea-392a-4483-a1a2-c03953ed8df9.jpg
comments.comment:
+James Gemmell As you are the expert on HFT, any theories, technical glitches or fat fingers, behind distortion of stock market by HFT?; I don't mind HFT if only way of the stock price is shot up.; It's hard to say for sure whether this was a flash crash without the kind of detailed exchange data that Nanex uses for their research into HFT, flash crashes and the like. http://www.nanex.net/FlashCrash/OngoingResearch.html
But then again, if it looks like a duck and quacks like a duck then it very likely is one. :-)

There are a lot of questions being asked about the usefulness of HFT. The "we provide liquidity" argument has been thoroughly debunked as the liquidity vapourizes when the algos detect a market anomaly and pull out - exactly when it is needed the most.; I'm going to go out on a limb +James Gemmell and say the HFT isn't useful except to those who speculate using HFT and thus are directly benefiting by making the market even more of a casino than it already was.; Oh dear - HFT Caught-Red Handed In FX Trading 
http://www.zerohedge.com/news/2012-10-31/hft-caught-red-handed-fx-trading; "Because in a market in which fundamentals have no bearing on anything, the only thing left is momentum... which works until mean reversion takes place." - Hear hear!!!  Fundamentals is the barrier between investing and spinning the wheel.
